numbered_ace_sentences: 2. A student can have a legacy status or a non-legacy status.
3. If a student has a non-legacy status and the parents of the student make more money then the chance that the student gets admitted is lower.
4. If a student has a non-legacy status then the student has a high chance to get admitted only if the student is in the top 0.1%.
5. This trend does not completely apply to legacy-status students.
6. If a student has a legacy status and the parents of the student make more money then the acceptance rate of the student is higher.
7. If a student has a legacy status and the student is in the top 0.1% then the chance that the student gets admitted is about doubled.
8. I wonder how long this trend will continue.
9. I wonder which colleges provided these statistics.
10. I am a high school junior.
11. I have peers in my community.
12. I wonder how this trend will impact me when I apply to colleges.
13. I wonder how this trend will impact my peers when they apply to colleges.
14. The headline is: Parents make or break college admissions.
